Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

TwilioRestClient

public TwilioRestClient(java.lang.String accountSid,
                        java.lang.String authToken)
Explcitly construct a TwilioRestClient with the given API credentials.

Parameters:
accountSid - the 34 character Account identifier (starting with 'AC'). This can be found on your Twilio dashboard page.
authToken - the 32 character AuthToken. This can be found on your Twilio dashboard page.

TwilioRestClient

public TwilioRestClient(java.lang.String accountSid,
                        java.lang.String authToken,
                        java.lang.String endpoint)
Explcitly construct a TwilioRestClient with the given API credentials and endpoint.

Parameters:
accountSid - the 34 character Account identifier (starting with 'AC'). This can be found on your Twilio dashboard page.
authToken - the 32 character AuthToken. This can be found on your Twilio dashboard page.
endpoint - the url of API endpoint you wish to use. (e.g. - 'https://api.twilio.com')

request

public TwilioRestResponse request(java.lang.String path,
                                  java.lang.String method,
                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> vars)
                           throws TwilioRestException
sendRequst Sends a REST Request to the Twilio REST API.

Parameters:
path - the URL (absolute w.r.t. the endpoint URL - i.e. /2010-04-01/Accounts)
method - the HTTP method to use, defaults to GET
vars - for POST or PUT, a map of data to send, for GET will be appended to the URL as querystring params This method is public for backwards compatibility with the old twilio helper library
Returns:
the twilio rest response
Throws:
TwilioRestException

requestStream

public java.io.InputStream requestStream(java.lang.String path,
                                         java.lang.String method,
                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> vars)
Request stream.

Parameters:
path - the path
method - the method
vars - the vars
Returns:
the input stream

safeRequest

public TwilioRestResponse safeRequest(java.lang.String path,
                                      java.lang.String method,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> vars)
                               throws TwilioRestException
Make a request, handles retries + back-off for server/network errors

Parameters:
path - the URL (absolute w.r.t. the endpoint URL - i.e. /2010-04-01/Accounts)
method - the HTTP method to use, defaults to GET
vars - for POST or PUT, a map of data to send, for GET will be appended to the URL as querystring params
Returns:
The response
Throws:
TwilioRestException - if there's an client exception returned by the TwilioApi

get

public TwilioRestResponse get(java.lang.String fullUri)
                       throws TwilioRestException
Perform a GET request against the given fully qualified uri. This is a shortcut to this#request(String, String, Map) with method "GET" and no parameters

Parameters:
fullUri - The full uri, including protocol://hostname/path
Returns:
TwilioRestResponse the response from the query
Throws:
TwilioRestException - the twilio rest exception

public java.lang.String getEndpoint()
Get the current endpoint this client is pointed at.

Returns:
String the api endpoint

setEndpoint

public void setEndpoint(java.lang.String endpoint)
Set the endpoint this rest client uses.

Parameters:
endpoint - The location of the endpoint (e.g. https://api.twilio.com)

getAccounts

public AccountList getAccounts(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params)
Get a list of Account objects. For more info: http://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/account

Parameters:
params - Filter the list with the given params. See the Twilio docs for available filters.
Returns:
the list of accounts.

getAccounts

public AccountList getAccounts()
Get all accounts. For more info: http://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/account

Returns:
the list of accounts.

getAccount

public Account getAccount()
A shortcut for the most common case, returning the Account object for this authenticated client.

Returns:
Account that maps to the authenticated account.

Parameters:
sid - The sid of the account you want to fetch.
Returns:
the account
